page.title: 05Superstitions & Ghosts
page.content: There is a gravestone in Tilsworth churchyard (cf.{page 4}) of an unknown girl found in 1821 by a tree in Blackgrove wood with her throat cut. Her murderer was never found but he was thought to be a Leighton Buzzard man who confessed on his deathbed to murdering his wife. It is purported that human blood has welled up from the foot of the tree or from a hole in the trunk ever since. There have been many reported sightings of a ghost seen at night, thumbing a lift along the Stanbridge Road. When cars stop to pick him up, after entering the vehicle he disappears. This seems to be the ghost of a man killed recently whilst walking along this road.
